item.title: Base of tree blocking view of traffic, 16th July
item.description:
The overgrowing base of this tree is blocking the view of tree while using the pedestrian crossing. You have to step into the road to see what's coming. If there is something coming down the road you'll be knocked down. Hazard for pedestrians.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 23, Lassa Road, Well Hall, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lots of rubbish dumped in the area., 16th July
item.description:
Huge amounts of rubbish dumped in the area. It is continuously being fly-tipped. CCTV would be recommended.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Braeside Crescent, Barnehurst, London

item.title: Dumped street bollards, 16th July
item.description:
A collection of ever growing dumped street bollards is collecting at the entrance to Walden Rec. Initially this was 1 bollard and 1 plastic sleeve. Now there are 4. Possibly from Sainsbury. This collection has grown over the last few days indicating persistent dumping over time.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Victoria Road, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car parked in designated spot in Steve biko lane, 16th July
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Steve Biko Lane, Southend, London

item.title: Top of Boades Mews, corner of Streatley Place, 16th July
item.description:
The street plate name seems to have been damaged. Used to read “Boades Mews - to Flask Walk” with a little hand symbol pointing downhill. Looked historic.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Streatley Place, Belsize Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Low traffic neighbourhood bollard has been removed and stolen, 16th July
item.description:
Walnut tree road had a low traffic neighbourhood bollard installed which has been removed and stolen. It is usually positioned outside number 50 walnut tree road. Please can this be replaced asap as traffic is already starting to drive illegally down the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 49, Walnut Tree Road, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tip to be removed, 16th July
item.description:
Remains of furniture and other household items left on the pavement in Mina road (SE17 2GJ) next to the entrance of Wouldham Court (On the corner with Old Kent Road) preventing passage and spilling in the street

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mina Road, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin men left rubbish and recycling bins in the middle of road, 16th July
item.description:
This blocked vehicles driving up Lords Close, I personally had to dodge the bins to get into my parking space. The bin men routinely leave the emptied bins in the road, forcing residents to put them back so they can safely reverse out of their space. The bin men need to be told to put the emptied bins back where they found them, it’s not hard!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lords Close, Tulse Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet
